text: New findings show that the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, a rotating soup of plastic in the north Pacific Ocean, contains up to 16 times more waste than previous surveys were able to detect. Source: http://www.abc.net.au/news/science/2018-03-23/great-pacific-garbage-patch-much-bigger-than-thought-study/9571234 …pic.twitter.com/WyJGzacLIw

“A March study found that a collection of 1.8 trillion pieces of trash in the Pacific Ocean known as the Great Pacific Garbage Patch could amount to 16 times more waste than previously thought.” | @ TIMEhttps://twitter.com/time/status/1003611085017178112 …

8 million tonnes of plastic waste ends up in oceans every year, comprising 80% of all ocean litter. Collection of 1.8 trillion pieces of trash in the Pacific Ocean known as the Great Pacific Garbage Patch could amount to 16 times more waste than previous… https://ift.tt/2kMnfyx

There is an area in the North Pacific Ocean called The Great Pacific Garbage Patch or 'Garbage Island' that is made up of nothing but plastic, cans and other waste that CAN BE RECYCLED. And guess what? It's almost 3 times the size of TEXAS
If you have not heard of the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, you will want to. It's a rotating pile of waste in the Pacific Ocean that is now larger than originally thought. http://ow.ly/zhQw30jCzxt

New entry: Great Pacific Garbage Patch, a zone in the Pacific Ocean that has a high concentration of plastic waste. It was discovered in the 1990s by Charles Moore, founder of @ Algalita Marine Research and Education. # EarthDay https://www.britannica.com/topic/Great-Pacific-Garbage-Patch …pic.twitter.com/LTCUfWa7jP

By 2050, there will be as much waste plastic in the ocean by mass as there are fish. A huge, swirling pile of trash in the Pacific Ocean, known as the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, is growing faster than expected&is now 3x the size of France, more than double the size of Texas. https://twitter.com/cnn/status/986195450746343425 …

New study by the @ TheOceanCleanup reveals the Great Pacific Garbage Patch contains nearly 1.8 trillion bits of # plastic waste along a stretch of the Pacific Ocean between Hawaii and California. http://time.com/5212078/great-pacific-garbage-patch-plastic-pollution-study/ … via @ TIMEpic.twitter.com/TCwoEBjL2d

A report published in the journal Scientific Reports has found that the Great Pacific Garbage Patch built up of plastic waste in the Pacific Ocean is now bigger than France, Germany and Spain combined, posing a dual threat to marine life. pic.twitter.com/zFCvJiUICZ

Slat said the first major operation will begin in 2018 in an area known as the Great Pacific Garbage Patch – a swirling vortex of mainly plastic waste located in the northern part of the Pacific Ocean. https://www.dezeen.com/2017/05/18/the-ocean-cleanup-begin-extracting-plastic-pacific-ocean-2018/ …

EPDA member Agru, recently extruded 600 meters of PE100 pipes, used in the largest plastic waste disposal action in the Pacific Ocean. AGRU is proud to be part of this great story which cleans up 50 % of the Great Pacific Garbage Patch in 5 years. http://ow.ly/q6Q130h2U5B
